lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around, roll dice, and play Dungeons and Dragons. You may notice Ashley Johnson left us last week to go shoot in New York and shooting got delayed a week.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Here I am! Well, hey, guys!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Astral projection!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I just came to hang out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to sign up to Loot Crate to get these and be awesome and keep our sponsors happy, you go to www.lootcrate.com/criticalrole, and there you can go ahead and sign up for a $3 a month discount by putting in the special code criticalrole, one word, into your subscription.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's the best.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we get to do this? We haven't opened any of these yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Loot Anime? Wait, we all have to have anime reactions to these.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, ready. Ready?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (anime reactions)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, this is super cool!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is definitely a Captain America shirt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Biggest Dragon Ball Z fan in the world.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's Super Saiyan Goku! That's pretty great! He's got gold hair.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Boy and little Chiko! I'm going to put it on my head.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fullmetal Alchemist transmutation circle!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We may or may not do voices in Fullmetal Alchemist and Dragon Ball Z.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Full circle!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got a cool poster!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You got a poster? Oh, there is a poster! Oh, and little cell phone charms!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, these are from Unity. These are little feather charms from Unity.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can someone save me a Loot Crate box?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shut up, Liam. You're not here!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry Liam, you're missing out. I'll save you a cell phone charm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So we got an awesome Yokai shirt.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They're like little best friend charms.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, they're like best friend charms.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And they're feathers! Actually, Liam, these are really appropriate. They're feathers. I'll save you one!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is going in the kitchen in front of the sink. I'm going to stand on it and transmute my dishes into clean.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I love this little plush.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Most useful alchemist ever.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yay! Thanks, Loot Crate!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Loot Crate. Check it out, if it's something you want to be part of, they send this stuff monthly, themed crates are awesome, we've been at this for a long time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't even know they had an Anime Loot Crate. That's pretty cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And now you do, Laura. What!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) The more you know!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome. So once again, that's criticalrole, one word, on their website at lootcrate.com/criticalrole to get your discount for being Critters and awesome. We have, also, Laura?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, the t-shirt competition! Okay. So we have officially selected the top three of our choosing, and then we are now presenting them to you guys to vote on. They are already up on geekandsundry.com, so go and check them out and make your votes heard, and we're going to be announcing the actual winner of the t-shirt competition at our live show next week, so everybody that comes and sees that will get to see a picture of it live. Just like you guys at home.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What a goober.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You basically see it 30 seconds before everyone else.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That 30 seconds makes a huge difference.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It does.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We may be miming something while the picture's up, and that'll be exclusive content.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And there were so many good ones. It was so hard.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The amount of texts that went back and forth between all of us, trying to decide what the top three were going to be, was really--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was like, okay, everybody pick your top three, and so we each picked six. And they were all different. And we're like, cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going be at Landmark Theatres. It's a sold-out show, somehow, because everybody's crazy and is coming to see it. We're going to be there, in person, trying to pull off this live show thing. It's going to be wacky, it's going to be zany. We're not going to have any clothes on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, that's not true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are welcome to come clothed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm gonna sit in a sock, and that's it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Travis, it's already sold out, you don't have to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's the first of hopefully many, so we'll see how it goes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, if it goes well and runs smoothly and people are receptive to it, then hopefully there will be more of these at different places over the country.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Guys, one more quick announcement, over here on the cool table. Joe Mad posters. You know them, you love them, they're up on shop.geekandsundry.com. It's your last chance to preorder the unsigned limited edition Critical Role poster. The poster size: it's not 23 by 35, it's 24 by 36. We went the extra inch for you guys. These posters will be removed from the website and deleted forever tomorrow at 1:00pm Pacific. The cost is $40. Go buy it now. Sorry, Taliesin. Let me try that again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We must reiterate, they are gorgeous. You will want one of these for you or your friends.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Trust Scanlan. It's that extra inch that makes all the difference.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's the extra inch, cubed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Any other announcements anyone wants to bring forward? I know Technomancer just came out. I voice Sean Mancer in that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What just came out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Technomancer.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A game. It's a game. Anybody else have anything?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a very half-hearted plug, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I just want to get in the game. It's a thing. There's stuff in it. Yeah, I'm a little jet-lagged. But that doesn't matter, because that's what energy drinks are for. All right guys, let's dive in here to the proper part of tonight's episode of Critical Role.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Opening credits! [dramatic music]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back! So we had a week off last week where the amazing Liam O'Brien there ran a one-shot game of absolute chaos and did an amazing job.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was pretty fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You took care of some business, managed to ward off an assassination attempt by a rakshasa, and found your way through Keyleth's Plane Shift spell into the Feywild, somewhere in the vicinity of the portal where the nymph in the Frostweald, upon meeting Vox Machina years before, supposedly lives.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit, Grog.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Time to get some... tail. I was going to say something else and then I realized-- Not sure where that came from.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So to bring us back in. As you step out into the temperate air, you're struck by the vibrant purples, blues and pinks of sunset that envelop the skies and the clouds above the tree line. The smell of fresh morning dew and poppy upon the breeze fills your head, and your feet wade through tall, thick grasses that tickle your knees with each step. Vine-covered tree trunks rise all around you, curling as they stretch upward like a bending dreamscape, and hundreds of small, bobbing faerie lights glow in the shadowed distance of the forest. Looking about you, you can see what appear to be clusters of mud and small pools of water that are scattered in your vicinity, some ten, 15, even 30 feet apart. Small, little pools that dot the landscape almost like pebbles scattered across a small field. What do you guys want to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Already?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where are we?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's beautiful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I feel like we got drugged.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is fantastic.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is anyone else seeing the colors and the shapes and the--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, it's everything I could have hoped for.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to live here. It's amazing. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I have no idea how to get our bearings here, unfortunately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well. Is there any sign of any bit of civilization or construction?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh lord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: First roll of the day. Don't fuck it up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ah! Yay. 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 26, okay. As you guys are taking in the vicinity, Percy, glancing around, you see no signs of civilization. The only thing that catches your eye is a little ways past the immediate tree line, that meets your eye, the fairy lights seem to be caressing the outside of some sort of older stone structure. And that's about as much as you can make out. Looks about four or five feet tall, and it's only barely visible between two of the trunks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I see a thing. I'm heading in that direction.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh! I want to go see a thing. I want to go! I take off after Percy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We can always let them go first and they die, and then we go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Perhaps it might be wise to move quietly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are already going.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Brilliant.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You remember what our teachers said of this place. It's pretty, but it's dangerous.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's very dangerous, and I'm afraid they don't understand.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Guys, look! They're fireflies!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, don't touch. Don't touch. We're going to head towards the stone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You make your way across these extremely thick, moss-covered tree trunks. You push past the two and eventually come upon the structure, and as you get closer, the fairy lights dim and vanish, as soon as you get within five or six feet of them, and they seem to only appear at a peripheral point. You guys approach the stone structure?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do Vex and I have memories of these from our tutoring in Elftown?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not particularly. Nothing about it strikes you as part of the general Feywild lore. There are structures that have been built throughout periods of time, some of which have fallen to ruin. Nature in the Feywild tends to reclaim things that aren't natural if left to their own devices.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But the lights, we never heard anything about those lights?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) Will-o'-wisps.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, Liam knows that, but I'm asking if Vax does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say, have both of you guys roll history checks, for the both of you. Vex and Vax.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I add into that, too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would not.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I learned Elven. I was a bit of a nerd.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You learned Elven, but elven culture and the Feywild are two entirely different things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah, I'm aware my head's full of bullshit, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13, okay. Best that you can ascertain, the first worry initially, and you have encountered something like this before: will-o'-wisps, entities that were the lost souls of individuals that died under tragic circumstances in swamps and bogs and in heavily wooded areas. However, those entities are usually larger and are drawn towards sources of life. The fact that these are much smaller and tend to fade at your arrival means either they're not will-o'-wisps at all, or a different kind you haven't encountered. That's as much information that you can deal with.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wonder if they're fairy folk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now, don't touch. We'll stay 11 paces away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd like you both to make stealth checks if you could.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anybody else going up with them, or is just the two of them?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, fuck those pieces of bait.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I climb a tree? Close by.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an athletics check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Athletics. Can I use my acrobatics to hop up? Ooh! Swing myself? Parkour?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll athletics with disadvantage, just because I'm giving you a chance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Acrobatics, with disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. This is the one time you've bartered with the DM this session.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! I should've saved it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You two, what'd you roll for stealth?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And a 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Liam, what'd you get?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I didn't roll anything. I just wanted to call out: you couldn't have used the broom for that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) Nope!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And we're keeping about 11 feet, so. At least.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 feet, okay. You approach this stone structure, which you see now is the corner part of a wall. It looks like there was some sort of a small structure here. Best that you can make out, all of it's heavily covered with vine and ivy, and all the places where the stonework is broken looks to be through natural erosion or claimed by actual roots, and you can see now part of the tree roots have actually risen up and tore down elements of these walls, and you can see broken rubble barely poking through the very thick underbrush of this forest. Whatever was here was built a long time ago and has been mostly reclaimed by the forest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Inner corner or outer corner?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The corner is facing you guys, so you're on the outside of where the structure would have been.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a ruin? Or are there walls that continue on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a ruin, but most of it's been torn down and it's not visible. Sections of walls available. The largest piece is currently the corner you're facing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Interesting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Go ahead. I'm going to sit and quietly sketch for a moment. I'm taking everything down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a check to see if I can recognize who might've built this stone structure?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a history check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no idea. The planes you've studied are the planes of the elemental form. The Feywild is a little ways outside of your realm of any training or storytime you've been given growing up. Most of what you've gleaned about it thus far has been based on the conversations you've had in recent weeks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there a lot of pastel colors all over the place?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It ranges from, at least in this forest, a very deep lush dark green, like a heavy winter's pine green. The forests are more vine-wrapped, mossy, willow-ish trees that hang down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, so not crazy LSD colors going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. However, the evening sky is very purple and orange, like around a very bright dusk. And that colorscape does contrast with the green of the forest quite beautifully.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it dusk?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks to be getting to dusk, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It may or may not be.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What does that mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Time is different in the Feywild.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So there's no carvings that I can see on this outer wall, nothing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not from ten feet away, no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And the vines that are climbing on it, are they flowering anything at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The vines that are there do have small whitish flower buds. Little flowers that have been blooming in a small scale across the vines.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they look like anything that we have on our plane?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not particularly. They look like white flowers from this distance. You'd have to get closer to inspect directly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Be very careful. Nothing here is exactly what it appears to be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I won't touch it! I'm going to-- it's so pretty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vex'ahlia!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? Yes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want to go higher and get a bird's eye view? Maybe that's not safe, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's why I'm staying in the trees, brother.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I meant even higher.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will if it looks safe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look safe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The canopy is very thick, and only in these small little patches of meadow, like the one that you entered and had all the little pools in it, and the one that you're entering now which has the ruin, have little breaks in the canopy where you can actually see the sky. Otherwise, it's very thick, so actually flying through the canopy, unless you're going very slowly, is going to be whipping you and probably knocking you off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I see from my height, can I see a better view of the ruins and everything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check. Keyleth, you approach the ruin to get a closer look at the plants? Make a nature check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! And this is forest, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. These white flowers resemble a form of daisy that exists in Tal'Dorei. However, they grow there in flower clusters out of the ground. You've never seen them sprout from a vine, and the shape's a little different, and you don't actually know this form of plant from your personal experience, but you can ascertain a similar nature to it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nothing is what it seems.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A "feysy." Are they poisonous or anything like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They don't appear to be toxic, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I touch it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you reach out and touch it with your finger, I need you to go ahead and do nothing, because it's fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You sneaky. Here we go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "As you" always means doom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I got 25 on my perception.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you rocket up past the boughs and begin to emerge from the edge of the canopy over this opening, you do see a very large water pool on the other side of this ruin. You can see where this ruin used to be. Most of it has fallen and then sunken into what appears to be a very glassy pool of water. A still surface, untouched. There's no wind in this area. It's a perfectly reflective surface to the opening above it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I see any life forms around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't see any life forms. You do see a bare minimum hint of movement, if you will, beneath the water. You can't make out the shape, but you do see something moving beneath the water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does this look similar to the pool that was on the other side of the portal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a pool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wouldn't know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like water. And you've seen a number that you've come past in this way. This one's larger than the others.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to pick the little white flower.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I wouldn't do that!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I come down and I watch as Keyleth makes a stupid move. Don't pick anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pluck the flower. As you pluck it, the vines begin to writhe and pull away from the stone, actually releasing the hold on the ruin, and as it does, you hear what sounds like some movement, some shifting of water on the other side of the stone wall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There was something in the water on the other side of the ruins.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take the flower and I put it back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The vine has retracted, and as you set it towards the vine, it tumbles off. And actually the flower, you see now as you reach down, it has turned from a beautiful white and has immediately withered into a black, dried husk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow. We've been here five minutes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was going to press it and keep it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not lying. We should probably hide!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where was once silence, you hear the rushing of leaves as the canopy's beginning to close over, like the trees are leaning in and the actual branches themselves are starting to close up the gap in space on the sky.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going stealth! Ducking into the grass!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stealth check on both you guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm hanging back with Grog. I've been scratching my back on his knee for a while.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't see what the big deal is, really.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Both of you guys-- you go back into the branch, and you can feel the branches pushing behind you, and you have to actually get low to not be dragged away with the rest of these extending branches that are closing off the opening in the canopy. Vax, you make your way towards one of the tree trunks and dart out of the way. Percy, you're watching this in horror.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm trying to very gently back her up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It's at this point, you guys see a hand creep up over the stone. A secondary hand.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe it's his version of a doorbell. You pick a plant and you get--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pulling up from here, you now see what appears to be a humanoid female form, lithe, hair wet and slicked back, and as the head peeks over--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I bow. And I push her down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need both of you guys to make constitution saving throws.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, not bad. 21.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural one. As you're shoved ahead, and begin to go into a bow, Percy, you bow, but you can't take your eyes off of it as the creature pulls herself up over the wall. An extremely beautiful, impossibly beautiful woman, nude, steps up over the edge of the wall, and as you glance forward, everything goes dark. Blackness.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is he still conscious?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You bow, and he appears to be bowing. He's still standing; he's fine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hello?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as you say that, the creature darts backward, and you see it take a few steps and then leap and dives into the pool and vanishes beneath the water's surface. Although you see that, Keyleth. Percy, you do not. You just hear footsteps.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh dear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What happened?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to have to find her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did she say anything?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She was very pretty. Are you okay?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think she blinded me. No, she blinded me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you look at Percy, eyes wide open, glancing about, the pupils moving about.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, I'm blinded. I'm blind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should test it out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. How many fingers am I holding up?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's a liar! He can see fine. Piece of shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog! Did you recognize that woman?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Were you paying attention?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You didn't see the naked woman come up over that wall?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where? Hold on. Did you hear that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If there was a naked woman, I would have seen it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to curl up in a little ball for a minute and rock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Percy crawls onto the ground and begins rocking back and forth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I come down out of the tree. Can you just be quiet for two seconds?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe it'll wear off in a minute?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (shushing) Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There was a naked woman. In a pool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That reminded me of maybe the pool on the other side. We were jumping over from close to that portal, right? Could it be the nymph that you stole the heart of?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She was very pretty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. Maybe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would it be safe for you to see her again and maybe ask for her to cure our friend here or would you-- Is she dangerous to be around?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, she didn't blind me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What'd she do to you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's none of your business.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I worry if we go try to talk to her if it's not her, then she could blind all of us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. My chick didn't blind me, so if she did, I think we need to kill her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take out my Dragonslayer Longsword and stand up and start using it as a cane. Find my way to Grog and poke him with it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Better. That's 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As they're having this conversation, you--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just a tap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find your way over, and sure enough, no person has the leg density that Grog does, and you're pretty sure you have your mark.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry! It's so hard to see.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sorry, I need to be more sensitive-- look out, it's a parrot! And I kick the sword.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A parrot?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, there are rabid parrots out here in the Feywild.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He kicked the sword.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let me get it for you. I'll hold onto it, since you're obviously useless now. I go pick up the Dragonslayer Longsword.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walk over to Percival. Percival, I'm worried you're going to walk your glasses into a tree or something. Do you want one of us to hold those for the time being?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take them off and put them in my pocket.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you have something to put them inside of, besides just the pocket? I don't want you falling on them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. I've got a thing. It'll be all right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Percival, would you like something to hold onto as you walk?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, if you don't mind, can I borrow a bear? Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, of course. I pop Trinket out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Trinket. (whoosh, bear noises)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi, buddy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jowls shake as you rub your fingers into his fur.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket, we're in a very weird place. A weird place. Things can happen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I whisper to Trinket: don't crush the flowers.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm willing to try and make this work for a moment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket, can you help Percival walk? He's blind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Matt! Pike is with us, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No? Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's back in Whitestone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. I robot out once in a while on Skype. I guess I missed that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. All right, so you feel the somewhat damp, cold nose of a bear nudge under your hand, and then (bear noises) and a shoulder lunges into you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now don't walk him into any trees, Trinket dear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you mind? I'm going to try and hop on top. I'm going to make a leap to get on top of the bear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It takes you a little while, but you get up onto the bear eventually. You have to right him because he's facing the wrong direction a little.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. So wait, can we be clear? You picked a flower, all the trees got pissed off, you went blind, some naked chick jumped a wall, and that's the story of what's happened so far? We are killing it right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't touch anything.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I feel like maybe we need a change in leadership. Just saying.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There are very large consequences for picking flowers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, which way did she go?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She jumped over the wall here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we follow?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Vax? Can you get a pair of eyes on her without going blind?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't feel confident about that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can try.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Which direction was this pool?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's right past the ruins. Right there, darling, can't you see? Grog, do you want to give it a go?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What? Go look for her?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just go see if it's her?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. Fuck it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Be quiet-- okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. And I do a full vault over the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You land, feet go (squelch) into the muddy outskirts of the pond. It's about up to your ankles, but you can see the water is now rippled and disturbed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I stick my fingers in the mud. Does it smell weird?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Smells like probably the freshest poolside mud you've ever come across.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I wipe it across my chest. Do I see any footprints from where naked chick went?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, none.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She went in the water, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She left no traces!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She was in the water before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does anyone want to come with me to the water?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll come with you to the water.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll go with you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're not going anywhere!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Trinket!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll go get your eyes back! Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far is the water? Can I see it from where I am now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It's about maybe ten feet from you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, I'll stealthily make my way ten feet towards it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a stealth check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Son of a bitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You put it in the descriptor, man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I did. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (squelching) You make your way, as markedly quiet as you can.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to sit on the wall and watch for a second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, you do have darkvision; a few of you do have darkvision, so it's not a huge hindrance within a certain distance. You do see what appears to be clouds of silt on the bottom of the water that have slowly found their way close to resting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I call out: hello? Nothing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No immediate response, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I reach in the Bag of Holding and grab a basilisk egg? And can I try to launch it as far as I can into the pool?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Go ahead and make a strength check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to scramble up next to Keyleth to watch this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23. You lob the egg with perfect accuracy directly into the center of the pool. It hits and floats on the surface, semi-buoyant, with a little bit of the shell revealed on the top. A few moments pass before a few fingers curl up and grab it, and pull it down below.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! I saw a hand!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you recognize the hand?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I'm not like Ray Charles. I can't tell if someone's attractive just by their hands.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog. Do you know how to float? Do you know how to float on top of water?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You should do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want me to put my body in there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right. Don't we want to talk to her?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if there's more than one her?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It went really well for you the last time that this happened.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! I figured it went well for you the last time. You're the only one who's done this before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but there were these invisible steps, right? I feel like we walked up some steps and then there was a portal. And she came out first! It wasn't like I went to her apartment and I was like: Hey! Want to hook up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey. Does this look like the pool you came into on the other side?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does this look like the pool I came into on the other side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You were distracted for the brief time you spent over here, but it does appear to be similar.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Similar?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Remember her name?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No! Did she have a name? Her name was Nymph!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't you call out her name?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: O Nymph! Where thee art thou?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit! Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as suddenly there's a burst of bubbles under the surface of the water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan! Whisper to Grog what to say to draw a lady out. You're very charismatic. And repeat what you hear Scanlan say.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Well, you've got to come closer, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Use your earring!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, we got earrings.

lines.name: MARISHA, ASHLEY
lines.text: Cyrano de Bergerac!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Cyrano that shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: O Nymph! Hear my call!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: O Nymph! Hear my ball!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope, call.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Call!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Once, we spent an afternoon together.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Once, we spent an afternoon together.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The sun never shone brighter.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The sun never shone brighter!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The clouds were never quite as fluffy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The clouds were never quite as fluffy!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it would make me a man again to see you once more.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. That was too much.

lines.name: SAM, TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! It would make me a man again to see you once more! I have a small dick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) "Oh. It has been some time." (gasping)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's her!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And she takes her hair off to the side and gets the water out of it and shoves it over her shoulder. She steps up, and this time her feet touch the surface, and she walks on it like it's solid. As she begins to step carefully towards you, "I apologize for being, well--" And she points over towards him. "I would recommend in the future, perhaps, a more respectful means of arrival."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (stage whisper) Sorry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If I recall, your name was Grog, is that correct?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right, my lady. Forgive me, your beauty has wiped my mind. Your name was?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Nala."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nala. I shan't forget again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I watch over this glade. It is bound to me as I am to it. I would hope that in the future "you'd be more gentle with that that resides here."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry. I'm a huge fan is all. Hi. I'm Keyleth, by the way. Of the Air Ashari--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're talking at this moment, there's a sudden sparking sound, like a heavy log has fallen in a forest with a crack and a thoom. There's a flash of light and she instinctively turns and then dives beneath the water once more. As you guys glance over, there's a somewhat shimmering form of light that congeals into a small gnomish female flickering in and out. As Pike, after coming back from your goodbyes and walking to the temple of Pelor now constructed to take at least a moment to begin building a bastion for Sarenrae worship here, as well, you miss your friends so hard in that moment that, for a brief moment, the divine energies give you one last brief moment to walk beside them across the planes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike! It's been five fucking minutes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Don't we have a gatestone? I'm sorry! I didn't want to stay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it because I owe you two gold?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, here it is!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, bye!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Buddy!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hi, buddy!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What the fuck did you just do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You missed the naked chick! There's a naked chick. She blinded Percival with her beauty.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, wow. Well maybe we can take it. Where is she?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, she went back underwater. Wait, do me a favor. Look, maybe everybody take a knee and be real chill while I throw down this swag, all right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry. Did I come in at a bad time?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, you cockblocked Grog a little bit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm sorry, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was on fleek and now I'm on flock.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The Feywild, you know? I know we just said bye, but I had to come. All right, let's do this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We all get down on a knee.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nala, it is a friend, not a foe. She's with me, and a great ally of ours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks out and looks towards you. "I remember "you, as well."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hi. I remember you. (stammering) I didn't mean to startle you. I didn't know everyone was in the middle of something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispering) She fucked her, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She met all of you guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh right, for a hot second. But then she took Grog--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I do apologize again for startling you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's all right. Not many things happen in this glade these days, so when they happen "rapidly, it tends to drop my heart a bit. Speaking of which, do you still carry my heart with you, Grog?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As you know, my lady, of course I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She turns her head. "I don't sense it on your person."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! Right. An actual-- No, I don't. We needed it for something. Yeah, so when last I saw you, I had this horrible bunk in my chest? It was terrible. And in combination with your heart, I was able to remove it and prolong my life. Which means I'm here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Glad you're safe. I shall begin the process of creating a new one, then. I'm glad it served you well."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It did, thank you. Many, many thanks. And you have our apologies again for beheading one of your flowers and for making all the loud snapping noises. This is not the way we wanted to start, believe me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She puts her hand up and nods.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I Druidcraft a Tal'Dorei daisy and give it back to-- I didn't mean to hurt your flowers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She nods and laughs. She brings her arm up and as she does, a singular vine seems to grow up out of the muck and curl up, and take the daisy from your finger and drag it off into the forest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I might ask, old bleachy-hair over here took a look at your beauty and all of a sudden went (raspberry) and can't see anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's a hard lesson learned."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you not get it back?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope, he's blind forever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It doesn't work that way. I'm sorry."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How does it work?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For the most part, those that fall under my protective gaze, they've earned it. Don't consider "past that. And my innate talents do not reach beyond that striking, so I'm sorry."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, totally cool. We're going to put some Braille on your gun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bet Pike has a few tricks up her sleeve.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think I could give it a go, with some things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have Regeneration on you today?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (quietly) Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it's probably mystical.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could attempt a Dispel Magic first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe you're just this way now, and your other senses will get better.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You could rock it for a while.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You said it's been very calm around here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No unexpected visitors or commotions lately?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not around my glade, no. I'd know."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: May I introduce to you Vex'halia?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We've met, yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that's right. I forget. She's seeking something in this place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, actually. We all are. Have you heard tale of a sick tree? Something very cancerous on the land.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are trees that fall under various states of corruption time and time again in the "Feywild. Light and darkness stands eternal here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This one holds a bow at its heart.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's located in a bog?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In a bog. Something about glass?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Near the river of the Gilded Run?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Shademirk Bog."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Shademirk Bog. That's the one!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is roughly two days duskward from here."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Duskward? That's west.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or what passes for west.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just started a page on the Feywild and now it's already-- there it is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nala, I'm sorry. I'm very simple. Is duskward actually west?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she puts her finger up, you can see the trees relax now and open up the sky above you, and you can see the direction where most of the setting sunlight is being cast into the sky, and she motions in that direction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you controlling the way the trees move?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is my glade. We are one."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. It's very impressive.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, can you teach people how to do that? Because that's awesome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll be moving on before then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know what? I'll talk to you later about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have you heard anything of this bow or this tree?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have not. I stay here. This is my home, and I am bound to it to not wander too far. What I "know of the Shademirk, I only know through individuals who passed through and kept me up to "speed with things that may or may not be transpiring in this landscape, but those meetings "are tens of years, if not more, between."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sorry. Have there been any significant changes of late? Cities here that didn't exist but a while ago?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not to my knowledge, no. My understanding of realms beyond this wood and beyond this glade "are fairly limited beyond what I've been given by passersby, and it's been not since you, Grog, "stepped through with me. I've not had another cross my path."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sounds lonely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The roots, they speak. The earth itself is "sustenance and the voice, the timeless voice of this land-- well, there are many stories here."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's so sweet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I really like her, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As we make our way towards this area, is there anything that you would warn us of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Everything."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. Everything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like don't pick the flowers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there anything specifically we should avoid? Specific plants, colors?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hands in the pocket policy going forward?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Gauge with care that which you tamper. Many things lie and live in these lands that could be "of aid and many, your own destruction. Words spoken by many who live and call the Feywild their "home are in themselves riddles. Deceit is their common form of time passage, and those that wander "from beyond, well, some would consider you more of a toy or a plaything than a visitor or passerby."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Before we leave, is there anything we might bring you on our way back through here, should we be successful?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) "Bring me some books."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Books?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'd like some books."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My kind of books? Pictures?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Pictures are always nice, but things to tell me of things beyond my sphere. Perhaps the "world you come from. Beyond the Frostweald, I know very little, as well."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a book on me. Would you like it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Take whatever you wish to say goodbye with."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. I basically have it memorized at this point, I've read it so many times.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes it and thumbs through.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 50 gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Markup's a bitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Closes it. "Thank you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before we set out. You've told us what to be wary of: everything. Is there anyone out there we can trust if come across them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Depends on what you seek and what your reasons are. Trust goes all ways. The difficulty "is finding who is aligned with your ideals, your intentions, and your goals, and who isn't. I trust "practically no one. Sorry."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm sorry, were you talking to me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's talking to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What were those little colored lights that disappear as we get close?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They're not dangerous."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do they lead you anywhere?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But they help me keep the glade in the forest."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was wondering if you have any sort of-- you're very well-versed with this area. Any form of protection you could offer us or recommend to us as we move forward in this confusing land?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Any last bit of advice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She thinks for a moment, holding the tome under her arm. "Well. I have minor magical "capabilities. Perhaps I could harden the physicality of one of you, in a way to aid. It "won't last long, but it's something."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Any assistance is more than greatly appreciated.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who's all tender?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Percy, at this point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Well, that's true.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many of us can you embolden?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm a bit useless at the moment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, don't sell yourself short. You're great.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You know I know what you're doing right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She steps forward, and as you're having this conversation, she puts her fingers towards the front of your forehead and touches your skin. You feel a surge of warmth through your body, though blackness still takes your vision. The rest of you watch as his skin suddenly turns to a dark brown and crackles. For a brief moment, you fear, but notice it's like his physical form, all parts of the pinky flesh of the human Percy become hard like tree bark.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's attractive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You got wood.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How's it feel?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I sniff Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like a fine cedar.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's nice. It suits you. It's very masculine. It's a musk.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. I'm still angry with you, but thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog, carve your name in him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! Oh my god. Holy shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I put the pistol slowly in the direction of his voice. My lady, I do appreciate your gift, and I do apologize for my friend and for startling you earlier. It is my deepest regret that I cannot take in the majesty of your realm for the moment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter) Of your realm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well. Keep your wits about you. That's the finest defense you have against this uncertain "landscape."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was a true joy seeing you again. We'll try to bring ourselves by this way on our way out as we can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I appreciate that. It is good to see your faces, as brief as it is."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, wish us luck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good luck and safe travels."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Bye, Nala.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As we walk away, I give Percy a wet willie.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I bow to her before I leave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we do that, too.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does she go for the wet willie?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I give you a wet willie.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are you trying to give me a wet willie? I use missile snare.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (pointedly) I bow before we leave.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not a ranged attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you bow. She turns around and begins to walk back down the invisible steps you see her taking, as she drifts deeper into the water, and actually, before she disappears beneath the surface, looks over her shoulder and smiles at you, Grog, and then disappears beneath the water below.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Be honest. You totally (tongue click).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I what? What's wrong with your mouth?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you get it on with her?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Copulation, Grog. She means did you do the thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Population? No. There's no population in that. I think it's just her in that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did she like the beard, though?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's right, you didn't have a beard before!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are having this conversation, there's a brief sound as Percy, even amongst his blinded state, catches Keyleth's finger in midair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I still don't say that's a ranged attack!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Gross. While the children play, I make my way towards the dusk direction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Toward the Shademirk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, hold on. I believe I was standing next to Keyleth, so I stick my pinky into my mouth and I shove it into Percy's ear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wet willie is happening!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Flanked by wet willies, Percy, one is halted, but in the distracted moment and the stealthy rogue being what he is, you feel the slimy insertion of a single half-elven digit into your ear canal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I say: Keyleth, that is really immature, really. What is the matter with you? And I walk off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Still angry at you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We should fix you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there any rocks or debris or little pebbles around on the ground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. There's plenty of stone debris.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take a small pebble. Pike, you really should do what you can to help Percy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Missile snare? With disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See, that

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He catches the pebble out of the air.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My kung-fu is far stronger than yours.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, Pike. Do your thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know if he needs it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have dreamed about coming here since I was a little child. I'm going to see this!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (stage whisper) Everybody, let's back up slowly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It gets really quiet suddenly, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm on a bear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Trinket stops and (bear noises).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (stage whisper) It's okay, Trinket.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (stage whisper) Pike, if you do this thing that you're going to do, will it take away his Barkskin, too?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know. That's why I'm a little nervous.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, you know. That's how it goes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, and to be fair, Barkskin, it's all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe it's temporary.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Barkskin is temporary.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I mean the blind part.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, the blindness? I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're all wearing your earrings. It's dangerous as it is, but--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's clearly hilarious, but Percival is our sharpshooter. I don't know if we want him--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He is

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, why would we want one when we could have two?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's try it, then.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, a blind sharpshooter might not be the best in the Feywild. I would throw it out there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Be a shame if your broom breaks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It really would. Hey, I want to heal you! All right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want to be healed or not, Percy? Jeez, first you say you're mad at me and then you ensnare my melee wet willie--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: People! We're tearing ourselves apart in the Feywild.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just reminding the dear what side her bread is buttered on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let Pike get rid of this blind spot so we can all be together again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's masterful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long has he been working on that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow. Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Critical Role, where you come for high fantasy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Give it a go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait. Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Say you're not mad at me anymore. Say: Hey, I know I've done things in the past to piss you off--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket, come here!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of a sudden, Trinket lurches forward and starts dragging him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Am I a reckless human?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So when I say you shouldn't probably touch anything, there's probably a really good reason, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Are you going to hold this one against me because I picked a flower, like how you held the Clasp against me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket's been dragging him away from you, towards her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hold against me like the Clasp?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need inspiration, Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, I think it's okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll have my revenge, but I love you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Get my way up Trinket and cast Greater Restoration.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So as you clutch your holy symbol, your flickering divine form drifts over towards the side of Trinket. You reach up and touch his leg, and the warmth of the divine energy surges through his leg. You can see it almost like a sparkle up his chest, little light rays peering out from beneath the clothing. It comes up his gullet, up the side of his face, and his eyes flash white, with beams of gentle sunlight shooting out for a second. The darkness becomes blurry, and your vision over the next 15 or so seconds returns to normal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You see?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, much better. Hi! It's so good to see you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Does he still have Barkskin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I come up from behind and give him another wet willie!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (yelps)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See? I got you even when you had your eyes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll make you a deal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Come here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we start moving forward? Yeah, we leave them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. We'll keep moving.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys catch up with the rest of the party, who's now moved on ahead. Making your way through this thick forest, I would like you all to make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Perception check?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice. 19. Natural 19.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you get, Liam?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. Okay. 25s or higher, which I think is Keyleth and Vex. You guys push through the forest for about another two hours or so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: While we do that, I take Percy's Barkskin, and I regal it out. I give him moss epaulets, grow some flowers on it, give him a little Whitestone flower crown. I'm making him a fancy tree.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A druidic Sergeant Pepper?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now we're even. Good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Two hours of travel towards the direction of the dusk, keeping tabs on it the best you can, you being the tracker you are, you notice that the night hasn't come. The light in the sky itself has not changed. The dusk hasn't waxed or waned; there's been no change in the sky light or color whatsoever. The dusk seems to have for the last couple hours been perpetual and unmoving.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe we're in the dusklands.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like I remember hearing that the time here is very strange.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It stays at a constant, correct?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, not necessarily.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe it moves slower here. I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We are moving towards dusk, correct? We're moving towards the setting sun?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're moving towards that. That was the one direction you were given by the nymph, yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It could be that we are either stuck in a loop or that we simply in an area of the Feywild that is eternal dusk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it feel like we're moving forward?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She said it was two days' travel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two dusks' travel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So we have to pass a dusk, at least.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That could be years.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It could.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you think it's safe if I fly up and look at the sky?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, but you might as well. Nothing's safe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I see any birds or anything like that in the sky? Any wildlife? Any critters?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Any critters?

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Critters everywhere.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, 21. Yes, 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, okay. You glance up at the next opening you have in the canopy, and you see occasionally a flock of birds go flying by. There is definitely vibrant wildlife, and you've seen throughout the forest here skittering squirrels and other creatures that live here, though themselves being skittish and running off as soon as your footfalls begin to hit that portion of the forest. There is a very vibrant critter lifestyle here within this part of the Feywild.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to try flying up. All right, I'm going to try flying up above the canopy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You come up above the canopy. Have to maneuver around some of the larger branches, and these trees are tall. You probably get yourself a hundred feet up before you finally break the canopy, and as you coast over the top you can see now before you, this forest is vast. The majority of it behind you, and you can actually see what appears to be the edge of the forest's line maybe about ten miles up, and past that you can see rolling grass hills before a mountain line. You can see in the distance, a very far distance-- make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm assuming I'm not in the forest anymore, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be looking beyond the forest, so yeah, it would not have advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Something that stands out, it's like a reflection or bead of light amongst the grass fields beyond the forest. You're unable to really tell the distance, but it does stand out as it occasionally flickers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Flickering. Do I see any sign of a city?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not from this perspective, no. Mostly, it looks natural from this view. Also, the clouds in the sky are slowly moving like normal clouds, and you can see in the distance what appears to be a sun that has passed beyond the mountain range, but there is no change in the light.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The sky looks the same?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Same it was since the moment you arrived.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, at least we know we've made some headway. I go back down. There's a tree line, at least. I think we should reach it soon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And if we don't, then we know that there's a problem.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And remember: in theory, from what little I know, the prettier it is, the more dangerous it probably is, and the older it is, the more dangerous it probably is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What, things get prettier as they get older here? That's not fair.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just the men.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, let's keep going, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys push on for another three or so hours--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're not out of the tree line yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the pace you guys are walking, you just begin to push outside of the trees. It was hard gauging the distance from that period of time; that was the rough estimate based on the perception roll. You begin to watch the tree line thin a bit. There's still many trees around you, but the density's beginning to scatter, and you're beginning to see more and more light let through from the treetops, and the trees themselves are not as tall as they were towards the central bulk of the forest. Vex, you do catch to your left side something that sounds like at first a little hiss, but instead it comes to your ear as a chuckle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hello?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did you hear something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is somebody there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh! Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural 20. You glance out of the corner of your eye, and you see about four trees behind you some outline of a shaded figure that darts behind a tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (stage whisper) Did anybody else see that?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, cool. Did it look childlike or adultlike?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In between.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We got a problem here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just be ready.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which direction?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Behind us. I saw you!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's get back-to-back, shall we?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to sit backwards on the bear while we move forward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to go back-to-back to the twins.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you want to say hello?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No response.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. I guess we'll have fun over here without you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you sure you really saw something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (forced laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You kill me. Oh man, who would want to miss this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't know a nun could curse like that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So funny. Anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's chest-high to the half-elves. A little below waist-high to you, and the gnomes are swimming through grass, at this point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, buddy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is fun, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want to keep staying down there doing the breaststroke?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No. I'm done.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It occurs to me, I don't actually have to ride the bear anymore.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true. Do you guys want to ride Trinket and see?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, thanks. I'll ride Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll ride Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hop on Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you still have Barkskin? Nice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He looks good, too, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's done me up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I give Trinket a scratch where it makes him go weird and start scratching his neck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (bear noises) He reaches up and gives you a lick, but it pseudo-passes through your form, and Trinket looks really confused and tilts the bear head to the side.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry, buddy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! As we're walking, first question: do I see any form of path through this grass?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's open field. Directionless and before you. There is still the dusk ahead of you. That's the best directional point you have right now, but there is no worn path. There is no road or street. There are no signs of civilization. It looks like an endless field.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've played the original Legend of Zelda. I know if we go up, left, down, left, we should get out of this field.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shoot the bush.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we going to intersect it in the direction that we're going?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You will get near it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so I'll keep an eye in that direction as we move forward, but I want to talk to you, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've been trying to find out a way to talk to Trinket like I know you can, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was wondering if maybe you could teach me how to do that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (gasps) Teach you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you think that's possible?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know! But I'd like to try.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that would be fun. Okay. Can I do something like that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a spell slot available for Speak With Animals that I never claimed that I want to learn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You want to take it? Okay. As you guys begin to walk through the field, you begin to reveal some of the druidic secrets of animal communication to Vex, and over the course of the next hour of travel--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See, the thing is, you have to get the accents right for each critter, or else they could get a little offended.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And you're the point of access.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Totally. I keep going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's less about vocality. It's about being able to connect on an empathic and emotional level, where creatures can speak to you less out of words and more out of the idea of emotions and thoughts, which our human minds-- or in some cases, half-human minds-- accept as words. There is no actual speech that they're talking, like, "Hello, my dear!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So one of the things that I like to do is embody the animal, and that can get you in the mindset.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will definitely keep that in mind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's practice being Trinket together.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I let her do that, and I'm going to keep walking normally.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She does it for a while.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go up to Grog. (sniffs, groans)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm learning so much.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think we're all learning. This is so great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wish Nala had cast Blindness on

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I walk up to Trinket and say: Hey, buddy. Can you understand me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you cast the spell?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket turns to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you understand me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (screams) I hug him so hard! Oh my gosh!

lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I basically wanted to say that I love you so much.

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I can stay in there all you need."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool. It's like when your dog comes in the room when you're peeing. It's a little awkward at first when you hear about it, but it's fine. It's okay. I'm fine with it. Whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you've actually been in there, so you have an idea of what he's talking about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He tells you that was fine, but you can tell through the subtle bear undertones that he wasn't too happy about it. But everything has this tone of basically whatever you need, and anything for you. There is an undying loyalty and love from Trinket that you've always felt, but now to hear in language form is very moving.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm watching quietly the whole time with a smile at this bear that I've known as a cub grunting with my sister grunting back, and it's very touching.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's comparable to the width of the valley between the Cliffkeep Mountains and the Stormcrest Mountains on Tal'Dorei. It seems like such a vast space, with no immediate scattered landmarks. In your head, which is used to gauging your position from small changes in the scenery, it's mind-numbing. It feels like it's endless.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. The source of the glimmer is becoming larger, but you can't make out any details. There are actually a few glimmers, clustered. It's one of those things where it's not perpetual. Every now and then you see it.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We press on until it's time to rest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You push on for a few more hours, and trying to think back how long you've been here, the time passes in a strange way to the point where you have no way of understanding how much time has gone by, but you're starting to get a little tired like you would towards the end of a day's worth of travel. You come up over a large hillside, and you can see now, there's a base of a mountain range that you can make out a little bit in the distance that meets up where that flickering is. You can see what appears to be now the source of the flickering. There looks to be some sort of a civilization. There are towers. There appears to be a stone ring around it. It's hard to make out the details from this distance, but it looks fairly large. It's in the side of the mountain range.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I say we camp here. I think it's a lovely idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's around us? Grass fields, pretty much?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just grass fields.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you can see, and then the hill line eventually gets so high in the distance where you can't see past it. You see the mountain range and whatever the source of this glimmer is, this strange, city-like series of structures at the base of that mountain range.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Let's set up shop, drop.

lines.text: 25. Vax, it's hard at this distance to make out much of the information, especially with the grass being as high as it is, and the hill beyond it. For the most part, the folks that can get a clear bead are those that are above the grass line and keeping a keen eye, which Vex is.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT
